label: 大織冠
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Highest rank (kurai) at the time it was in use. [位]↓Nakatomi Kamatari was given the family name of Fujiwara [i.e. became Fujiwara Kamatari], the hereditary title (kabane) of Ason, the Cap of Greater Woven Material (Dai-shok-kan)[the highest cap rank (kan-i)], and appointed Great Minister of the Center (Naidaijin) [the highest office at that time] [in 669] (Part A: p. 152). [中臣鎌足、藤原、姓、朝臣、官位、内大臣]
